precondition: The Windows XP desktop is visible.
action: Click the 'Start' button on the taskbar.

precondition: The Windows XP Start menu is open and the mouse cursor is hovering over the 'Control Panel' option. A yellow tooltip box describing the Control Panel is visible.
action: Click on 'Control Panel' in the Start menu.
expected_results: The tooltip box will disappear and the Control Panel window will open.

precondition: The Windows XP Control Panel is open and in Category view.
action: Click on the "Appearance and Themes" category.
expected_results: The "Appearance and Themes" category will become highlighted.

precondition: The "Appearance and Themes" window is open within the Windows XP Control Panel.
The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Themes" tab is active.
expected_results: The "Screen Saver" tab will become active. The preview pane will display a screen saver preview, and the "OK" and "Apply" buttons will become active.

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open, and the 'Screen Saver' tab is selected.
action: Click the 'Screen Saver' dropdown menu and select 'None'.
expected_results: The screen saver setting will change to 'None'.

precondition: The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window is open.
action: Click the "10" entry in the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu will close, and the "Wait:" field will display "10".

precondition: The 'Display Properties' window is open and the 'Screen Saver' tab is selected.
action: Click the 'Power...' button in the 'Monitor power' section.
expected_results: The 'Power Options Properties' window will open.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open, and the "Home/Office Desk" power scheme is selected.
action: Click the "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu will expand, displaying a list of time options.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Power schemes" dropdown menu is visible.
action: Click the "Power schemes" dropdown menu and select "Always On".
expected_results: The "Power schemes" dropdown will display "Always On" as the selected option. The "OK" button will become highlighted.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Power Schemes" tab is selected.
action: Click the "Power schemes" dropdown menu and select "Always On".
expected_results: The "Always On" power scheme will be selected in the dropdown menu.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open and the 'Power Schemes' tab is active. The 'Always On' power scheme is selected in the dropdown menu.
action: Click on 'Always On' in the 'Power schemes' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Always On' power scheme remains selected.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Always On" power scheme is selected.
action: Click the "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu.
expected_results: A dropdown menu with different time options for hard disk inactivity will appear.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Always On" power scheme is selected.
action: Click the dropdown menu labeled "Turn off monitor".
expected_results: The dropdown menu will expand to display a list of time intervals. The option "After 20 mins" will be automatically selected.

precondition: The 'Power Options Properties' window is open with the 'Always On' power scheme selected. The 'Turn off monitor' dropdown menu is open.
action: Click the 'Never' option in the 'Turn off monitor' dropdown menu.
expected_results: The 'Turn off monitor' dropdown menu will close, displaying 'Never' as the selected option. The 'Cancel' button at the bottom of the window will become unhighlighted.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Cancel" button is highlighted.
expected_results: The "OK" button will become highlighted, indicating the cursor is now hovering over it.

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open with the "Screen Saver" tab selected. The "Cancel" button is highlighted.
expected_results: The "Display Properties" window will close without saving any changes. The "Cancel" button will become unhighlighted, and the mouse cursor will move over the "OK" button.

precondition: The "Appearance and Themes" window of the Windows XP Control Panel is open.
action: Click the "Display" icon located below the "or pick a Control Panel icon" section.
